page.title: 11 Public Houses and Clubs.
page.content: There are only 2 public houses left in Woodford Halse.They are The Sir Winston Churchill(formerly The White Hart) and The Fleur-de-Lys.The Licencees are Jame C.W.Vine and Jean Mary Beveridge. There is a working men's club run by a committee.Mr.& Mrs.R.Sprague,who live on the premises,act as stewards.The club was the former Railwaymens'club which closed when the railway was demolished in 1966.Before the railway came the building was an hotel and hunting lodge.Accomodation includes:bar where darts,skittles etc.are played; cellar with full-size snooker table;TV lounge;Steward's rooms,upper bar with pool table;secretary's and committee rooms;large concert room.In the top floor flat the Great Central Railway Enthusiasts Club has a large OO guage layout,library and museum.Membership is open to anyone who can get 2 sponsors.
